node.title: Tairāwhiti residents staying positive despite two cases reported in region
node.description: Tairāwhiti DHB chief executive Jim Green said some Christmas plans have been disrupted, but residents are still staying positive.
node.content: ["RNZ", "The COVID-19 testing centre in Tair\u0101whiti has been impressed with the turnout today, and those going home to isolate are in good spirits.", "Two cases were reported in the region yesterday and the Peel Street testing centre re-opened this morning.", "Around 50 people got tested during a three-hour window.", "Tair\u0101whiti DHB chief executive Jim Green said some Christmas plans have been disrupted, but residents are still staying positive.", "\"It's a difficult day for everybody given that it is Christmas Day and normally people would be getting together, and now these two people are having to self-isolate.", "\"So that's not so easy but they've all come in in good spirits and good intentions to help us out.\"", "Most people who were tested were possible contacts of the two cases, Green said.", "The testing centre has closed for the day, but Three Rivers Medical Centre is testing until 6pm.", "Both people who tested positive yesterday are in the same household - the second person has been in self-isolation and will remain there for another nine days.", "The positive results follow repeated wastewater tests detecting COVID-19 in the Tair\u0101whiti area this month.", "RNZ"]
